main event: B-47 crew sighted a small object estimated at 35,000 feet near Portland, Maine on December 10, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 4 minutes without gaining or losing altitude., The object appeared similar to a star from a distance and was noted for its bright appearance and speed., Observers stated the visibility was unlimited and there was no unusual meteorological activity at the time., Witnesses included experienced B-47 pilots, who were considered extremely reliable., The object was suggested to be a celestial body, likely coinciding with the orbital track of Sputnik Beta.
sighted object: a small bright object in the sky
location: 20 Mi. S. of Portland, Maine, USA
witness description: B-47 air crew members, experienced pilots with considerable flying experience.
